items.description: River Blackwater and The Cove Brook
items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels are high but steady on the River Blackwater and The Cove Brook as a result of heavy rainfall earlier in the week. Therefore, flooding of low lying roads and farmland is expected to continue, especially in the Swallowfield area. Further isolated showers are expected today 08/07/21 with low confidence over exact timings and locations. River levels are falling, but still pose a flood risk and remain sensitive to further rainfall. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated this evening, 08/07/21, or as the situation changes.

Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated this evening, 08/07/21, or as the situation changes.

Therefore, flooding of low lying roads and farmland is expected to continue, especially in the Whistley Green area. Further isolated showers are expected today 08/07/21 with low confidence over exact timings and locations. River levels are falling but still pose a flood risk and remain sensitive to further rainfall. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.
